metadata.Title: CVE-2021-44118 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
SPIP 4.0.0 is affected by a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability. Toexploit the vulnerability, a visitor must browse to a malicious SVG file.The vulnerability allows an authenticated attacker to inject malicious coderunning on the client side into web pages visited by other users (storedXSS).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-44118` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

spip - 4.0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: spip package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.1').
